com.microsoft.windowsazure.core.utils

Class Utility

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.microsoft.windowsazure.core.utils.Utility

  • public final class Utility
extends java.lang.Object
    RESERVED FOR INTERNAL USE. A class which provides utility methods.

      • determinePathStyleFromUri

        public static boolean determinePathStyleFromUri(java.net.URI baseURI,
                                java.lang.String knownAccountName)
        Returns a value that indicates whether a specified URI is a path-style URI.
        Parameters:
        baseURI - A java.net.URI value that represents the URI being checked.
        knownAccountName - A String that represents the known account name to examine with baseURI, or null to examine baseURI on its own for being a path-style URI.
        Returns:
        true if the specified URI is path-style; otherwise, false.

        Parameters:
        value - A Date object that represents the date to convert to UTC date/time in the ISO8061 pattern. If this value is null, this method returns an empty string.
        Returns:
        A String that represents the UTC date/time for the specified value using the ISO8061 pattern, or an empty string if value is null.

      • readElementFromXMLReader

                                        java.lang.String elementName)
                                                 throws javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException
        Reads character data for the specified XML element from an XML stream reader. This method will read start events, characters, and end events from a stream.
        Parameters:
        xmlr - An XMLStreamReader object that represents the source XML stream reader.
        elementName - A String that represents XML element name.
        Returns:
        A String that represents the character data for the specified element.

        javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException - If an XML stream failure occurs.

      • readElementFromXMLReader

        public static java.lang.String readElementFromXMLReader(javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamReader xmlr,
                                        java.lang.String elementName,
                                        boolean returnNullOnEmpty)
                                                 throws javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException
        Reads character data for the specified XML element from an XML stream reader. This method will read start events, characters, and end events from a stream.
        Parameters:
        xmlr - An XMLStreamReader object that represents the source XML stream reader.
        elementName - A String that represents XML element name.
        returnNullOnEmpty - If true, returns null when a empty string is read, otherwise EmptyString ("") is returned.
        Returns:
        A String that represents the character data for the specified element.
        Throws:
        javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException - If an XML stream failure occurs.

      • safeRelativize

        public static java.lang.String safeRelativize(java.net.URI baseURI,
                              java.net.URI toUri)
                                       throws java.net.URISyntaxException
        Determines the relative difference between the two specified URIs.
        Parameters:
        baseURI - A java.net.URI object that represents the base URI for which toUri will be made relative.
        toUri - A java.net.URI object that represents the URI to make relative to baseURI.
        Returns:
        A String that either represents the relative URI of toUri to baseURI, or the URI of toUri itself, depending on whether the hostname and scheme are identical for toUri and baseURI. If the hostname and scheme of baseURI and toUri are identical, this method returns a relative URI such that if appended to baseURI, it will yield toUri. If the hostname or scheme of baseURI and toUri are not identical, this method returns the full URI specified by toUri.
        Throws:
        java.net.URISyntaxException - If baseURI or toUri is invalid.

      • trimStart

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The string with whitespace trimmed from the beginning.
